definitions.text: the elasticity of something that can be stretched and returns to its original length
cause to have, in the abstract sense or physical sense
examples: She gave him a black eye
The draft gave me a cold

definitions.text: be the cause or source of
examples: He gave me a lot of trouble
Our meeting afforded much interesting information

definitions.text: transfer possession of something concrete or abstract to somebody
examples: I gave her my money
can you give me lessons?
She gave the children lots of love and tender loving care
Give one's name

definitions.text: convey, as of a compliment, regards, attention, etc.; bestow
examples: Don't pay him any mind
give the orders
Give him my best regards
pay attention
hold a reception
have, throw, or make a party
give a course

definitions.text: convey or communicate; of a smile, a look, a physical gesture
examples: Throw a glance
She gave me a dirty look

definitions.text: give as a present; make a gift of
examples: What will you give her for her birthday?

definitions.text: cause to happen or be responsible for
examples: His two singles gave the team the victory
give thought to
give priority to
pay attention to
The cow brings in 5 liters of milk
This year's crop yielded 1,000 bushels of corn
The estate renders some revenue for the family
give a secret to the Russians
leave your name and address here
impart a new skill to the students
The trompe l'oeil-illusion establishes depth
Can I give you my keys while I go in the pool?
Can I give you the children for the weekend?
Give a gulp
give a yelp
He gave his life for his children
I gave two sons to the war

definitions.text: place into the hands or custody of
examples: hand me the spoon, please
Turn the files over to me, please
He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers

definitions.text: give entirely to a specific person, activity, or cause
examples: She committed herself to the work of God
give one's talents to a good cause
consecrate your life to the church
I gave him the drug
She gave him First Aid
I gave him a punch in the nose
give homage
render thanks
grant a degree
give a divorce
This bill grants us new rights

definitions.text: move in order to make room for someone for something
examples: The park gave way to a supermarket
`Move over,' he told the crowd
Feed the starving children in India
don't give the child this tough meat
I gave at the office
The wall collapsed
The business collapsed
The dam broke
The roof collapsed
The wall gave in
The roof finally gave under the weight of the ice

definitions.text: estimate the duration or outcome of something
examples: He gave the patient three months to live
I gave him a very good chance at success
Give bond
I'll give you three books for four CDs
the door opens to the patio
The French doors give onto a terrace
He gave the sign to start
Pollini is giving another concert in New York

definitions.text: be flexible under stress of physical force
examples: This material doesn't give
He gave the first of many toasts at the birthday party
give a decision for the plaintiff
This student gives promise of real creativity
The office gave evidence of tampering
He gave her his word

definitions.text: submit for consideration, judgment, or use
examples: give one's opinion
give an excuse

definitions.text: guide or direct, as by behavior of persuasion
examples: You gave me to think that you agreed with me
I give you two minutes to respond
She gave the boy a good spanking
The judge gave me 10 years
what gives?

definitions.text: consent to engage in sexual intercourse with a man
examples: She gave herself to many men
She gave her hand to her little sister
